data.chText: 排空；（使）流光；放干
data.enText: to make sth empty or dry by removing all the liquid from it; to become empty or dry in this way

data.chText: 把通心粉过一过水。
data.enText: Drain and rinse the pasta.

data.chText: 沼泽地里的水已排干。
data.enText: The marshes have been drained.

data.chText: 你得先把中央供暖系统的水排净再更换散热器。
data.enText: You will need to drain the central heating system before you replace the radiator.

data.chText: 游泳池里的水排得很慢。
data.enText: The swimming pool drains very slowly.

data.chText: 把碟子控干。
data.enText: Leave the dishes to drain.

data.chText: （使）流走，流出
data.enText: to make liquid flow away from sth; to flow away

data.chText: 我们必须把发动机里的机油全部放掉。
data.enText: We had to drain the oil out of the engine.

data.chText: 把肉里面多余的油沥掉。
data.enText: Drain off the excess fat from the meat.

data.chText: 她拔掉塞子，让水流走了。
data.enText: She pulled out the plug and the water drained away.

data.chText: 这条河流入湖中。
data.enText: The river drains into a lake.

data.chText: 我把这消息告诉他时他脸色变得煞白。
data.enText: All the colour drained from his face when I told him the news

data.chText: 我的怒火慢慢平息下来。
data.enText: My anger slowly drained away.

data.chText: 喝光；喝干
data.enText: to empty a cup or glass by drinking everything in it

data.chText: 他一口喝干了杯中的水。
data.enText: In one gulp, he drained the glass.

data.chText: 她一下子就把最后一点儿酒喝掉了。
data.enText: She quickly drained the last of her drink.

data.chText: 使（精力、金钱等）耗尽
data.enText: to make sb/sth weaker, poorer, etc. by using up their/its strength, money, etc.

data.chText: 我母亲的住院开销把我的收入渐渐耗光了。
data.enText: My mother's hospital expenses were slowly draining my income.

data.chText: 我感到筋疲力尽。
data.enText: I felt drained of energy.

data.chText: 令人精疲力竭的一段经历
data.enText: an exhausting and draining experience

data.chText: 下水道；排水管
data.enText: a pipe that carries away dirty water or other liquid waste

data.chText: 我们只得叫个管子工来疏通下水道。
data.enText: We had to call in a plumber to unblock the drain.

data.chText: 下水道排水系统是本世纪初修的。
data.enText: The drains (= the system of pipes) date from the beginning of the century.
grate
sewer grate

data.chText: 下水道孔盖
data.enText: a frame of metal bars over the opening to a drain in the ground

data.chText: 消耗；耗竭；耗费
data.enText: a thing that uses a lot of the time, money, etc. that could be used for sth else

data.chText: 军费开支是对国家资源的巨大耗费。
data.enText: Military spending is a huge drain on the country's resources.
(go) down the drain
(go) down the plughole

data.chText: 被浪费掉；变得非常糟糕
data.enText: (to be) wasted; (to get) very much worse

data.chText: 你要知道，这是白白丢钱。
data.enText: It's just money down the drain, you know.

data.chText: 安全标准根本不管用了。
data.enText: Safety standards have gone down the drain.
laugh like a drain

data.chText: 哈哈大笑；放声大笑
data.enText: to laugh very loudly

ex.enText: There's something wrong with the drains.

ex.chText: 他没时间修理堵塞的排水管。
ex.enText: He has no time to repair the blocked drain.

synonyms.bx: 尤指挖于地上供水流通的沟渠。

ex.enText: He fell into the ditch in the dark.

ex.chText: 路边的沟里积了些雨水。
ex.enText: There is some rainwater in the ditch along the side of the road.

synonyms.bx: 指挖于田边、路边等处用于蓄水或排水的沟。

data.enText: (go) down the drain
(go) down the plughole

data.chText: 被浪费掉；变得非常糟糕
data.enText: (to be) wasted; (to get) very much worse

data.chText: 你要知道，这是白白丢钱。
data.enText: It's just money down the drain, you know.

data.chText: 安全标准根本不管用了。
data.enText: Safety standards have gone down the drain.
laugh like a drain

data.chText: 哈哈大笑；放声大笑
data.enText: to laugh very loudly

tr: emptying something accomplished by allowing liquid to run out of it
a gradual depletion of energy or resources
example: a drain of young talent by emigration

tr: a pipe through which liquid is carried away
tube inserted into a body cavity (as during surgery) to remove unwanted material

example: Life in the camp drained him
The exercise class drains me of energy
The rain water drains into this big vat

value.def: If you drain a liquid from a place or object, you remove the liquid by causing it to flow somewhere else. If a liquid drains somewhere, it flows there.

example.ex: Miners built the tunnel to drain water out of the mines...
example.tran: 矿工们开凿了一条地道，以排出矿井里的水。

example.ex: Now the focus is on draining the water...
example.tran: 现在的重点是把水排走。

example.ex: Springs and rivers that drain into lakes carry dissolved nitrates and phosphates...
example.tran: 流入湖中的泉水和河水携带了溶于水的硝酸盐和磷酸盐。

example.ex: The water slowly drained away, down through the porous soil.
example.tran: 水慢慢流走了，渗入了疏松的土壤。

value.def: If you drain a place or object, you dry it by causing water to flow out of it. If a place or object drains, water flows out of it until it is dry.

example.ex: Vast numbers of people have been mobilised to drain flooded land...
example.tran: 大量的人力被动员去排干受涝的土地。

example.ex: The soil drains freely and slugs aren't a problem.
example.tran: 土壤排水畅通，鼻涕虫就不会造成什么麻烦。

value.def: If you drain food or if food drains, you remove the liquid that it has been in, especially after it has been cooked or soaked in water.

example.ex: Drain the pasta well, arrange on four plates and pour over the sauce...
example.tran: 将意大利面中的水分滤干，放在4个盘子里再淋上调味汁。

example.ex: Wash the leeks thoroughly and allow them to drain.
example.tran: 彻底清洗韭葱，再沥去水分。

value.def: A drain is a pipe that carries water or sewage away from a place, or an opening in a surface that leads to the pipe.

example.ex: Tony built his own house and laid his own drains.
example.tran: 托尼自己盖了房子并铺设了下水管道。

example.ex: ...storm drains.
example.tran: 排洪管

value.def: If someone drains a glass, they empty it by drinking what is in it.

example.ex: Pamela drained her glass and refilled it.
example.tran: 帕梅拉喝完后又续了一杯。

value.def: If the colour or the blood drains or is drained from someone's face, they become very pale. You can also say that someone's face drains or is drained of colour.

example.ex: Harry felt the colour drain from his face...
example.tran: 哈里觉得他脸上的血色在消失。

example.ex: Thacker's face drained of colour...
example.tran: 撒克面无人色。

example.ex: Jock's face had been suddenly drained of all colour...
example.tran: 乔克的脸突然变得煞白。

example.ex: His usually florid complexion seemed drained of colour.
example.tran: 他通常红润的脸色看上去没有了血色。

value.def: If a feeling drains or is drained out of you, it gradually becomes less strong until you no longer feel it.

example.ex: And then, suddenly, the euphoria began to drain away...
example.tran: 随后，狂喜的感觉突然开始消失了。

example.ex: She felt the tension drain out of her...
example.tran: 她感到紧张情绪在消失。

example.ex: The happiness and the excitement had been drained completely from her voice.
example.tran: 幸福和激动已经完全从她的声音中消失了。

value.def: If something drains you, it leaves you feeling physically and emotionally exhausted.

example.ex: My emotional turmoil had drained me.
example.tran: 纷乱的情绪让我心力交瘁。

value.tran: 使精疲力竭;使心力交瘁

example.ex: United left the pitch looking stunned and drained.
example.tran: 曼联队离开球场时看上去备受打击，身心俱疲。

example.ex: This work is physically exhausting and emotionally draining.
example.tran: 这项工作让人身心交瘁。

value.def: If energy drains or is drained from you, you lose all energy and become very tired.

example.ex: As his energy drained away, his despair and worry grew...
example.tran: 当他的精力耗尽时，他的绝望和担心也增加了。

example.ex: I can help resolve conflicts that drain energy.
example.tran: 我可以帮助解决消耗精力的冲突。

example.ex: He could rest only when he was too drained of energy to fret further.
example.tran: 只有当他精疲力竭无力再操心时他才能得以休息。

value.def: If you say that something is a drain on an organization's finances or resources, you mean that it costs the organization a large amount of money, and you do not consider that it is worth it.

example.ex: ...an ultra-modern printing plant, which has been a big drain on resources...
example.tran: 资源消耗很大的超现代印刷厂

example.ex: Fraud trials are often complex and have become an expensive drain on the public purse.
example.tran: 诈骗案通常错综复杂，会给公共资金造成巨大损失。

value.tran: (金钱或资源的)大量消耗，耗竭，耗费

value.def: If you say that a country's or a company's resources or finances are drained, you mean that they are used or spent completely.

example.ex: The state's finances have been drained by war...
example.tran: 国家财力已经被战争消耗殆尽。

example.ex: The company has steadily drained its cash reserves.
example.tran: 公司已逐渐用完了其现金储备。

value.def: If you say that something is going down the drain, you mean that it is being destroyed or wasted.

example.ex: They were aware that their public image was rapidly going down the drain...
example.tran: 他们意识到他们的公众形象正迅速被毁掉。

example.ex: He lamented that four years of his life had gone down the drain because of an injury to his groin.
example.tran: 他痛惜他四年的生活就因大腿根部的伤被毁掉了。

value.def: If you say that a business is going down the drain, you mean that it is failing financially.

example.ex: Small local stores are going down the drain.
example.tran: 当地的小店都倒闭了。

trans: 地漏；供应不锈钢地漏；地面排水管；地漏系列；地面排水
（使）流出（走）；将一定量的酒喝光
排水井；减压井；渗水井；导渗井；枯井
排水管；排泄管；下水管；排水配管；排污管
每况愈下；前功尽弃；付之东流
（使）从…流出（走）；离开，被吸引而脱离（某地）（不用于被动结构）
储油槽；排水箱（坑、孔）；排水槽（池）
